clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Different Sports Supplements on Metabolism and Perceptual Responses During Distance Running
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Different Sports Supplements on Metabolism and Perceptual Responses During Distance Running

brief_summary.textblock: Several previous studies have shown that repeatedly ingesting carbohydrate supplements during exercise training sessions, over a period of days and weeks, can gradually increase carbohydrate oxidation and reduce gut discomfort during exercise. However, repeatedly ingesting large amounts of carbohydrate during training sessions can be burdensome and can cause gut distress. Thus, it would be advantageous if the same long-term benefits could be realized from consuming these carbohydrate supplements at rest instead of specifically during training sessions. Therefore, the goal of this study is to examine whether repeatedly ingesting a carbohydrate-rich beverage at rest over a 5-day period alters metabolism and gut symptoms while ingesting carbohydrate during exercise.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Symptoms will be collected during a 60 minute run on a treadmill at a baseline visit and at a second visit after ingesting the carbohydrate or placebo beverage for 5 days.
primary_outcome.description: Symptoms such as nausea, fullness, belching, reflux, abdominal cramps, flatulence, and urge to defecate will be recorded on a 0-10 scale (0 = no discomfort, 10 = unbearable discomfort).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples will be collected before after a 60-minute run at a baseline visit and at a second visit after ingesting the carbohydrate or placebo beverage for 5 days.
primary_outcome.description: Samples of expired air will be tested for hydrogen levels, a marker of carbohydrate malabsorption

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Respiratory gases will be collected during each 60-minute run at a baseline visit and at a second visit after ingesting the carbohydrate or placebo beverage for 5 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory gases will be used to estimate carbohydrate oxidation rates.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Ratings will be collected collected before and during each 60-minute run at a baseline visit and at a second visit after ingesting the carbohydrate or placebo beverage for 5 days.
secondary_outcome.description: A bipolar scale ranging from -5 (very bad) to +5 (very good)

arm_group.description: A glucose-fructose beverage mixture supplying 100 grams of carbohydrate per day for 5 days

intervention.description: The carbohydrate beverage will supply approximately 100 grams of carbohydrate per day (in the form of glucose and fructose)
The placebo beverage will contain aspartame.
